description: Write a function called `unpack_tuple(data)` that takes a tuple of (name, age, city) and returns a formatted string: '{name} is {age} years old and lives in {city}'.
output_specification: Expected output format will be shown.
sample_outputs: Alice is 30 years old and lives in NYC
Bob is 25 years old and lives in LA
Charlie is 35 years old and lives in Chicago
Diana is 28 years old and lives in Boston
explanations: For input [['Alice', 30, 'NYC']], output is Alice is 30 years old and lives in NYC
For input [['Bob', 25, 'LA']], output is Bob is 25 years old and lives in LA
For input [['Charlie', 35, 'Chicago']], output is Charlie is 35 years old and lives in Chicago
For input [['Diana', 28, 'Boston']], output is Diana is 28 years old and lives in Boston
notes: Implement the Tuple Unpacking problem correctly
Consider edge cases and boundary conditions
Test your solution with various inputs
hints: Start with the base case or simple scenario
Build up to the complete solution step by step

test_cases.expected: Alice is 30 years old and lives in NYC
Bob is 25 years old and lives in LA
Charlie is 35 years old and lives in Chicago
Diana is 28 years old and lives in Boston
